    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(Context context,
        java.lang.String token)
        Initializes Encanta without any custom listeners to pass incoming data from Encanta to your app
        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        token - The Token displayed in the 'App Setup' portion of the web portal for your app

      • init

        public static void init(Context context,
        java.lang.String token,
        OnNewMessageReceived newMessageReceivedListener)
        Initializes Encanta with a custom listener for when a new message is received
        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        token - The Token displayed in the 'App Setup' portion of the web portal for your app
        newMessageReceivedListener - The listener defining what your app wants to happen when an incoming message is received. Such as notifying the user with a dialog, a toast, updating badges within the app, etc

      • init

        public static void init(Context context,
        java.lang.String token,
        OnChatEnabledToggled chatEnabledToggledListener)
        Initializes Encanta with a custom listener for when real-time chat is enabled/disabled through the Encanta portal.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        token - The Token displayed in the 'App Setup' portion of the web portal for your app
        chatEnabledToggledListener - The listener defining what your app wants to happen when Real-time Chat is disabled through the Encanta web portal. Notably, hiding/showing the option to initiate a support chat within your app as applicable.

      • init

        public static void init(Context context,
        java.lang.String token,
        OnNewMessageReceived newMessageReceivedListener,
        OnChatEnabledToggled chatEnabledToggledListener)
        Initializes Encanta with a custom listener for when a new message is received as well as when real-time chat is enabled/disabled through the Encanta portal.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        token - The Token displayed in the 'App Setup' portion of the web portal for your app
        newMessageReceivedListener - The listener defining what your app wants to happen when an incoming message is received. Such as notifying the user with a dialog, a toast, updating badges within the app, etc
        chatEnabledToggledListener - The listener defining what your app wants to happen when Real-time Chat is disabled through the Encanta web portal. Notably, hiding/showing the option to initiate a support chat within your app as applicable.

      • setUserId

        public static boolean setUserId(java.lang.String userId)
        Sets a userId to be used for this user. Generally used on apps that require logging in, and provide a way to reconcile the data from Encanta with data that may be in other systems for this given user. Must be called prior to calling init()
        Parameters:
        userId - The id to use for this user
        Returns:
        true if userId was valid and successfully set

      • setPromptForUserName

        public static void setPromptForUserName(boolean prompt)
        Used to determine whether or not to prompt the user to enter their name when first starting the support chat activity. If setUserName() was already called, this will have no effect. Defaults to false - signifying that the user will not be prompted to enter their name
        Parameters:
        prompt - true for the user to enter their name on the first instantiation of the support chat activity, false to have no prompt and use a generic 'User ####' identifier within the Encanta portal. Defaults to false.

      • setMessageReceivedListener

        public static void setMessageReceivedListener(OnNewMessageReceived listener)
        Explicitly set the custom listener which is called when a new message through Encanta is received.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener defining what your app wants to happen when an incoming message is received. Such as notifying the user with a dialog, a toast, updating badges within the app, etc

      • setChatToggledListener

        public static void setChatToggledListener(OnChatEnabledToggled listener)
        Explicitly set the custom listener which is called when real-time chat is enabled/disabled through the Encanta portal for your app.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener defining what your app wants to happen when Real-time Chat is disabled through the Encanta web portal. Notably, hiding/showing the option to initiate a support chat within your app as applicable.

      • startSupportChatActivity

        public static void startSupportChatActivity(Context context)
        Used to start the main Encanta activity for support chats. Allows users to see all messages they have sent or received through the tool
        Parameters:
        context - The Context object that this is being called from

      • setUserName

        public static void setUserName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the user name tied to a given user. Can be updated if the user has the ability to change their profile in the app and update their name, and everything about the user is preserved. Can be used in cases where the user can log in or register themselves when using your app.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to associate this user with

      • setStringProperty

        public static void setStringProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Sets a String user analytics property for the current user that will be displayed in the Encanta web portal in the contextual information on the current user
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the property
        value - The string value of the property

      • setIntProperty

        public static void setIntProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                  int value)
        Sets an int user analytics property for the current user that will be displayed in the Encanta web portal in the contextual information on the current user
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the property
        value - The int value of the property

      • incrementProperty

        public static void incrementProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Increments a given int user analytics property for the current user by 1. This will be displayed in the Encanta web portal in the contextual information on the current user.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the int property to increment by 1

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled()
        Check to see if Real-time Chat is enabled for this app through the Encanta web portal. Use this to determine if the user should be presented with the UI control to initiate an Encanta support chat.
        Returns:
        true if real-time chat is enabled, false if it is disabled

      • getEncantaVersion

        public static java.lang.String getEncantaVersion()
        Get the version of Encanta currently being used
        Returns:
        String representation of the current Encanta version being used

      • getUnreadMessageCount

        public static int getUnreadMessageCount()
        Gets the number of unread Encanta messages
        Returns:
        the number of unread Encanta messages

      • pauseNotifications

        public static void pauseNotifications(boolean pause)
        Conditionally pauses all notifications from Encanta to your app through the custom listeners. Use if you want to have cases where the user isn't explicitly notified when a new message comes in or when the enabled state is toggled. Can be used if the user puts the app in the background, or if they are performing a critical operation where they shouldn't be disturbed during it.
        Parameters:
        pause - true if all notifications from Encanta to your app should be paused, false if your app's custom listeners should be notified on notification.

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Allows the logging level within Encanta to be set if necessary. Accepts the default Android logging constants as input.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - One of the default Android Logging level constants: Log.WARN, Log.INFO, Log.DEBUG, Log.VERBOSE, Log.ERROR
